alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 3:59AM CDT until October 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...South winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to around 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum afternoon values 15 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Upper 80s to lower 90s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
